data.name: str_extension
data.comment: File extension / type to save as

data.name: str_location
data.comment: Folder path location to save file into

data.name: str_message_run_as_admin
data.value: Please run the application as administrator!

data.name: str_select_folder
data.value: Select a folder for saving this file

data.name: str_autosave_balloontext
data.value: Hold shift key during save to show option window.

data.name: str_autosave_infotext
data.value: Files are now automatically saved without prompting for filename and extension. Instead, the file created will be selected for renaming in the explorer window. To show the dialog again, run the PasteInfoFile executable without arguments or hold the SHIFT key while selecting the context menu entry.

data.name: str_noclip_text
data.value: Clipboard is empty or contains unsupported data

data.name: str_clear_clipboard
data.comment: Checkbox to clear clipboard after saving

data.name: str_wizard_contextentry_info
data.value: By adding entries to the File Explorer context menu, you can quickly paste clipboard contents into files or copy file contents via right click.

data.name: str_file_exists_directory
data.value: A directory with the same name already exists at {0}.

data.name: str_file_exists
data.value: The file {0} already exists. Do you want to overwrite it?

data.name: str_autosave_checkbox
data.comment: Checkbox to toggle autosave mode, for which no pop-up dialog is displayed, but the file is directly saved without prompt.

data.name: str_wizard_autosave_info
data.value: You can configure Paste Into File to automatically save the file. When enabled, the dialog prompting for filename and extension is skipped and the file will be created and selected for renaming in the explorer window instead. To temporarily invert the setting, hold the SHIFT key when running Paste Into File. Note that the dialog is always shown when executing Paste Into File without command line arguments.

data.name: str_continuous_mode
data.comment: Checkbox for batch mode, in which files are automatically saved every time new data is copied

data.name: str_template_edit_info
data.value: The template is used to format the filename. The following variables are supported: {0} - Date and time {1} - Save count in batch mode For details on the format specifiers click here.

data.name: str_continuous_mode_enabled_ask_savenow
data.value:
In batch mode, clipboard contents will be saved instantly when new data is copied.
Save current clipboard contents now?

data.name: str_copy_failed_unknown_format
data.value: The file {0} contains data of unknown format which cannot be copied to the clipboard.

data.name: str_error_cliboard_format_missmatch
data.value: Clipboard contains no data convertable to extension {0} or conversion failed.

data.name: str_wizard_tray_info
data.value: If enabled, Paste Into File is started on windows startup and keeps running in the system tray. This allows to call Paste Into File by pressing WIN+ALT+V (and WIN+ALT+C to copy file contents). In addition, you may enable clipboard patching. This monitors the clipboard and patches it automatically, so you can use CTRL+V in file explorer as usual. These setting will take effect on the next login.

data.name: str_copy_failed_not_single_file
data.value: Please select a single file to copy file contents
data.comment: Error message displayed when trying to copy file contents to clipboard while the number of selected files does not equal 1

data.name: str_preview_files
data.value: File list preview ({0} files and folders)

data.name: str_clear_clipboard_tooltip
data.value: Clears the clipboard after its content has been saved.

data.name: str_autosave_tooltip
data.value: Saves clipboard data to default filetype without prompt. Hold SHIFT to temporarly invert this setting.

data.name: str_wizard_autosave_may_open_new_explorer
data.value: Autosave may open explorer (e.g. when pasting into subfolder)

data.name: str_always_on_top
data.comment: Checkbox in window bar context menu. Allows to keep application window always on top (in foreground of other windows), even if not focussed.
